formattedAddress: 1399 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1399 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

editorialSummary.text: Classic light fare & organic breads fill out the menu at this rustic-chic bakery/cafe chain.

originalText.text: The staff were so nice! We walked in 3 minutes before closing and they still served us without any frustration. The food was so good for a great price. We will definitely be going again! The fruit is so fresh even at closing time.

text.text: The staff were so nice! We walked in 3 minutes before closing and they still served us without any frustration. The food was so good for a great price. We will definitely be going again! The fruit is so fresh even at closing time.

originalText.text: Le Pain Quotidien in NYC offers a delightful culinary experience with a charming ambiance. Nestled in the heart of the city, their menu boasts deliciously fresh and wholesome dishes that cater to various palates. The rustic yet cozy atmosphere elevates the dining experience, creating a welcoming retreat from the city buzz. While the food undoubtedly shines with its quality and taste, the only setback might be a slightly slower service, but the wait is certainly worth the culinary delights that await.

originalText.text:
Great breakfast stop to sit and enjoy your breakfast without being rushed. Breakfast bowl is really good and the fresh baked pastries.They have couple of marmalade, jam spreads to try and
cappuccino comes in a size of a bowl

cappuccino comes in a size of a bowl

originalText.text:
I've been to this location a couple of times so far. My family sees doctors at Mount Sinai so after our visit we usually go there for breakfast or early lunch.

Each time I've visited, we got the same food. Both times it was equally delicious. We ordered the mini dutch pancakes. I highly recommend them. So small, so fully of flavor. The bananas are a perfect compliment. I do wish they would serve syrup along side it. There can be three or so mini pancakes with no topping so i personally would of love to add extra syrup to the pancakes.

We also got the skillet eggs with bacon and scallion. I also love this dish. Its eggs in a cute small skillet with crumbled pieces of bacon and a big handful of scallion. I wish the eggs were kept a little runnier but i understand that its hard to stop the cooking when the skillet itself gets really hot as well. The eggs are served with a couple of pieces of bread and butter on the side. Since the skillet is hot, i personally enjoy heating up the bread and butter on the pan.

To drink i got the iced latte. It's pretty good. I appreciate that it wasn't light. The coffee taste and flavor was still never strong despite all the milk added with lattes. My daughter got the hot chocolate. It was okay. I feel like it needed more chocolate. We had to add way too much sugar because it originally tasted like warm milk.

During my prior visits, i was able to get good seats at a booth. This time i had to sit at the long table instead. It was okayy, an experience. We shared the table with three other parties of two/three. The layout of this place is a little off some. I almost wish there was more space. The decor here is simple but beautiful. Almost farm chic or so.

The staff here is friendly and easy going. This doesn't feel like a stuffy place despite the area which i love. I personally love how quickly i have always been serviced here. No wait for anything is never long at all. I love it and cannot wait to return.

originalText.text: Had just finished an appointment up here at Mount Sinai and hadn't had breakfast or lunch yet. My wife introduced me to this place. Very nice little spot with a great selection of goodies. Best thing here was what I called The Big @ss Cookie (My wife wanted to call it the Ginormous Cookie of Epic Proportions but mine just rolls off the tongue better). That and the Cream Filled Donut were to die for. The sandwiches and soups were good too. Just be aware that you are paying Manhattan prices (items could have been bigger with those prices). Still a fun experience. Have to go back and try some other goodies we missed.
